intro: Kaviria aucheri, commonly known as the Persian violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Kaviria aucheri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
